summary.intent: Add missing OpenCode and OpenAI Codex logos to the agent UI and display which files each coding agent generates, shown contextually near agent selection controls.
summary.outcome: All three frontend files were successfully modified with logos and generated-file hints, 1309 tests passed, lint was clean, but the changes were bundled into an unrelated Husky checkpoint commit rather than a clean dedicated commit.

repo: SVG assets for agents live in frontend/assets/agents/ and must be manually converted to inline React components in AgentLogos.tsx
agentLogoMap in AgentLogos.tsx is the central registry for agent logos used across the app
The project uses Biome for both linting and formatting; auto-fix is available and needed after some edits
Husky post-commit hook creates automatic 'checkpoint' commits, which can absorb staged changes from a prior failed commit attempt
Pre-commit hook runs TypeScript typecheck across the entire project, not just staged files — unrelated unstaged errors can block commits
GitHub Copilot generates files in both .github/copilot-instructions.md and .github/instructions and .github/skills directories

code.finding: Central file for agent logos and the new AGENT_GENERATED_FILES constant mapping agent keys to generated file paths
renderAgentCard() function where agent logos were added above agent name inside detection cards
Provider <select> element location where 'Generates: ...' subtitle was inserted below the dropdown
Target agent button group location where 'Generates: ...' subtitle was inserted
Contains a pre-existing TypeScript error unrelated to this task that blocks the pre-commit typecheck hook

workflow: When pre-commit hooks typecheck the full project, existing errors in unstaged files can block commits for unrelated changes — isolating staged files does not help
After a failed commit attempt, Husky's post-commit hook may fire and create a checkpoint commit that absorbs previously staged files, making it appear the commit succeeded

friction: Pre-commit hook ran typecheck on the entire project and failed due to a TypeScript error in an unrelated unstaged file (ai-file-consolidator.test.ts)
Attempting to unstage unrelated files caused all staged files to be dropped, requiring re-staging
The commit ended up bundled inside an auto-generated Husky checkpoint commit rather than as a clean, isolated commit
Biome formatting required a separate auto-fix pass after one of the edits
open_items: Pre-existing TypeScript error in src/shared/remediation/ai-file-consolidator.test.ts needs to be fixed to unblock future commits
Uncommitted changes remain in src/shared/remediation/engine.ts and src/shared/types/remediation.ts from a separate workstream
The agent logo/generated-files changes are mixed into an unrelated checkpoint commit — consider rebasing to isolate them into a clean commit if commit history cleanliness matters
